text: A thin, hungry raven landed on a fig tree, and seeing that the figs were still green, he stood still and waited for them to ripen. She saw a fox starving the raven perpetuated on the fig tree, and asked him what he was doing. And he said to him, Thou hast done evil, that thou hast wasted the time that thou hast trusted in a distant hope; hope is filled with good delusion, but not with food. If you have an immediate need, you cannot satisfy it with unattainable things.
title: La zorra y el cuervo hambriento
author: nan Esopo
